definition[0]: the same person, place, thing etc is one particular person etc and not a different one
example[0]: He sits in the same chair every night.
example[1]: They went to the same school.
example[2]: It is those same people who voted for the Democrats who now complain about their policies.
example[3]: We stood in front of the very same house in which Shakespeare wrote his plays.
example[4]: She was born on the same day as me.
definition[1]: used to say two or more people, things, events etc are exactly like each other
example[5]: Both women were wearing the same dress.
example[6]: The same thing could happen again.
example[7]: The furniture is made in much the same (=almost the same) way as it was 200 years ago.
example[8]: That’s funny – Simon said exactly the same thing.
example[9]: He gets the same pay as me but he gets his own office.
definition[2]: used to say that a particular person or thing does not change
example[10]: Her perfume has always had the same effect on me.
example[11]: He’s the same old Peter – moody and irritable.
definition[3]: used to say that two people, things, events etc are exactly like each other
example[12]: The houses on the street all look the same.
example[13]: They were doing the same jobs as the men, but being paid less.
definition[4]: used to say that there is very little difference between two people, things etc
example[15]: There are insects that look exactly like green leaves.
definition[5]: identical  things are exactly the same in every way
example[16]: The tablets were identical in size, shape, and colour.
definition[6]: two things that are indistinguishable are so similar that it is impossible to know which is which or to see any differences between them
example[18]: The copy was indistinguishable from the original painting.
definition[7]: two or more amounts, totals, levels etc that are equal are the same as each other
example[19]: Spend an equal amount of time on each essay question.
definition[8]: to be the same, even though you expect them to be different
example[20]: People often think that movie stars are special, but really they’re no different from anybody else.
definition[9]: if you  can’t tell the difference  between two people or things, or if you  can’t tell them apart, they look, sound, or seem exactly the same to you
example[21]: Emma and Louise sound so alike on the phone that I can’t tell the difference.
example[22]: They both gave the same reason for leaving
example[23]: I’d like the same sort of car
example[24]: The buildings all look the same
bad_example[0]: They both gave a same reason
bad_example[1]: I’d like a same sort of car
example[25]: His answer was the same as mine
explanation[2]: this same or that same followed by a noun, to emphasize it
example[26]: At that same moment, the telephone rang
